definition: (chess) the capture by both players (usually on consecutive moves) of pieces of equal value, change over, change around, as to a new order or sequence
details:
noun
- (chess) the capture by both players (usually on consecutive moves) of pieces of equal value
= example: (chess) the capture by both players (usually on consecutive moves) of pieces of equal value
- (chess) gaining (or losing) a rook in return for a knight or bishop
= example: (chess) gaining (or losing) a rook in return for a knight or bishop
- the act of putting one thing or person in the place of another: 'he sent Smith in for Jones but the substitution came too late to help'
= synonyms: substitution, commutation
- reciprocal transfer of equivalent sums of money (especially the currencies of different countries)
= synonyms: interchange
- the act of giving something in return for something received
= example: the act of giving something in return for something received
- the act of changing one thing for another thing
= example: the act of changing one thing for another thing
= synonyms: interchange
- (sports) an unbroken sequence of several successive strokes
= synonyms: rally
- a workplace that serves as a telecommunications facility where lines from telephones can be connected together to permit communication
= synonyms: central, telephone exchange
- a workplace for buying and selling
- a mutual expression of views (especially an unpleasant one)
= example: a mutual expression of views (especially an unpleasant one)
- chemical process in which one atom or ion or group changes places with another
verb
- change over, change around, as to a new order or sequence
= synonyms: switch, switch over
- exchange or replace with another, usually of the same kind or category
= synonyms: change, commute, convert
- exchange a penalty for a less severe one
= synonyms: commute, convert
- give to, and receive from, one another
= synonyms: interchange
- put in the place of another
= synonyms: interchange
- hand over one and receive another, approximately equivalent
= example: hand over one and receive another, approximately equivalent
